intro: Scutellaria indica var. coccinea, commonly known as red skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and striking red to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
